message:
Fantastic series, Stephen, I learned a few things. I'd not heard of Surge before, it sounds very useful, and I'd not heard the term ChatOps before.

If you're interested in fully automated deployment previews, even from forks, I'd love to hear your thoughts on [Tugboat](https://tugboat.qa).

Congrats on both the successful scripting of this using GitHub Actions and the documenting of it for everyone to benefit from! :clap:

Thanks for the detailed write-up, GitHub Actions are sometimes a pain to write but they're very powerful!

It looks like everyone is reinventing their own way of creating ephemeral staging environments these days, so I decided to package everything I knew and publish the [PullPreview GitHub Action](https://pullpreview.com) for anybody to reuse.

It implements a workflow similar to yours but is based on labels instead of comments:
* env is started by applying a label on the PR
* env is destroyed when removing the label, or when merging or closing the PR

It also supports any kind of application, as long as it can be started with docker-compose. Environments are started on cheap AWS lightsail instances in your own account, with support for SSH access, pretty URLs and Let's Encrypt HTTPS.

I think you might be interested, especially since the whole code is open source ;)
